summary:
When Worlds Collide...- Peter Parker x Reader, Barry Allen x Reader, MCU x DCU Crossover.
PART 1
title:
When Worlds Collide...- Peter Parker x Reader, Barry Allen x Reader, MCU x DCU Crossover.
PART 1
body:
Warnings: None.

Summary:  Y/N L/N and Barry Allen were speedsters testing out a device to enhance their speed, but Y/N somehow manages to travel to another Earth where she comes to find out that the Y/N from there is dead and the only people that can help her get back home is the friends and family of her dead doppelganger. She meets Peter Parker, the boyfriend of the late Y/N Stark and emotions are all over the place. He takes her back to the Avengers tower to meet Tony Stark and the Avengers and things get emotional again and weird.

Next Part  - Masterlist

“Barry, I don’t know, if I can run that fast.” You sigh, heavy breaths sounding like your lungs were suffocating. Barry was trying to help you get to Mach 2 under a few seconds and it was harder than it sounded. Training was a real pain in the legs mostly, but it helps.

“Yeah you can Y/N. I believe in you. Come on, just relax okay. Deep breaths-” he says encouragingly, walking towards you, hands extended, pulling you into a hug, rubbing your back soothingly.

“I know I need to do this, and I know that we need to be faster than Zoom but Barry it’s hard.” You grunted, feeling of hopelessness and a hint of fear settling in.

“Hey, it’s okay, we’re gonna be able to do this, okay? I believe in you Y/N, in us.” Barry says as he pulls you closer and you instantly relax at the simple, loving action.

“Guys we need you in the cortex now.” Caitlyn’s voice booms through the speakers, interrupting you both and alerting the two of you of the team meeting, with hopefully good news or any news regarding the other metas in the city.

“Race ya there?” Barry smirks, getting ready to run.

“Oh, you’re so on Flash.” You chuckle, as you both run out of the speed lab, straight to the cortex.

Your relationship with Barry was kind of unusual. You weren’t together but sometimes you both acted like you were? It was a sort of unspoken thing and you guess that the reason that neither of you questioned it or said anything is because, well the both of you didn’t want things to go bad between each other. You were good friends, throughout all the bad stuff that had happened to you both, you were always there for each other. You loved Barry and Barry loved you. When the particle accelerator exploded, Barry and you had gotten your powers, the exact same powers. You were visiting him at his lab at CCPD when it had happened, woke up a few months later and your lives were forever changed. With the good, came the bad, arguments and disagreements with Barry were more often and it wasn’t something either of you liked. But you both worked on it, communicating better, and things have been going well. It has been 3 years and your friendship were still strong, but now it was also a partnership, The Flash and Swift.


“Barry, Y/N, I need you both to take these with you, run somewhere and wait for our signal.” Cisco says as we enter the cortex, handing us the tachyon devices.

Taking the identical devices from Cisco, Barry and you speed change into your suits and sped away, meeting at the Keystone City boarder. Coming to a stop, Barry gives you a nod and you both start to talk to everyone back at S.T.A.R Labs through the comms, waiting for the signal.


“Okay you guys, we’re here, you got our location?” Barry asks through his comms, awaiting a response from Cisco or even Caitlin, as you did too. You were excited to try the tachyon device out, it’s supposed to be like this supercharge battery that well, charges the speed force in us.

Back at S.T.A.R Labs, Cisco asks us, “You good? You guys don’t need to like stretch or somethin’?”


“No no no we’re good, Cisco.” You answer, chuckling at your friend.

“Let’s take this tachyon enhancer out for a test drive.” Cisco says trying to sound cool, Caitlin and Iris standing closely behind him, not wanting to miss anything.


“Alright.” You say as you turn to face Barry. His hands come up to cup your face, fingers lightly brushing your cheeks before he places a gentle kiss to your lips. Pulling away, he nods, gives you a reassuring smile and places the device on his chest, you mimic his actions, jumping a bit at the sudden reaction you feel your body have to it, you feel kind of jittery and well, nervous. You lick your lips and ball up your fists before squeezing your eyes shut as you mentally prepare for the outcome of this.


“Whoo! Yeah!” Barry exhales, feeling the device work.

You have the same reaction; it really does feel like your speed force cells are being supercharged. “Woah, I feel that!” You exhale.


“That is the tachyon device, powering up the speed force in your cells like a quick charge battery.” Caitlin says, sounding very chipper.


“How do you guys feel?” She asks.

“Uh, weird, but in a good way.” You answer, feeling a rush of energy.

“Different, really different.” Barry says with a sweet smile plastered on his face. His excitement was quite evident.


“Let’s see how long it takes for you to get back here, on my count…” Cisco says. That was the signal, well kind of, it was a count-down but same thing. You and Barry, got into position, waiting for that go.


“You ready Flash?” You smirk at the handsome speedster next to you.

“…3..2…”

“As ready as you are Swift.” He grins, shooting you a rather flirty smirk.

“..1..Go!” Cisco says as starts watching the timer on the clock, waiting for Barry and you to return to the S.T.A.R Labs.

Barry and you run, much much faster than before.


“Dang, this thing has them crusin’…” Cisco says, honestly impressed by you guys speed.


“How fast do they normally go?” Iris asks, interested about this whole situation and kind of worried about you and Barry.

“Not this fast.” Caitlin says nonchalantly.

“Not even close, are their vitals okay?” Cisco asks as his eyes widen at how fast the two of you are running around, the city.

Looking at the screen, Caitlin is relieved and kind of impressed, “Yeah, they’re perfect.”


“Cool, it’s like having a pit stop attached to your chest.” Iris says impressed.

“Guys, I can go faster!” You say as you ran throughout the city.

“Yeah, guys, me too!” Barry says.

A grin appears on Cisco’s face as he simply says, “Do it.”


Smiling to yourself you ran, faster that you’ve ever ran before. Hell, probably faster than Barry has too, but you sort of ran so fast that you managed to travel to another Earth. You didn’t know that at first, but you found out eventually.


How did you find that out, well eventually from the guy dressed in a red and blue suit who you saved from a falling building indirectly told you so? After speaking to him for a few minutes you knew for a fact that he wasn’t a meta from Central City.

You had spotted him the moment you came to a stop, scanning the area you, ran up the building, catching him swiftly, like your name sake and ran towards a field, although you didn’t mean too.


“I’m on fire!” the guy exclaims, through his mask as he tried to put the fire out.

“Yeah uh… sorry about that it happens sometimes, with the fiction of running at…” You say but the actions of the guy makes you stop for a moment, you look at him, his suit, head to toe and wonder, who is he and where did he get it, but he has something else to say, something extremely weird but not unbelievable.

“You sound like her.” He says, taking a step back and removing his mask. You examined his face, but sadness clouded his features. He looked at you, but you had your mask on, your identity was still hidden, and it seemed to disappoint him.


“By the way, I didn’t need you to save me.” He grimaced.

You were taken aback by that statement, confused. “Uh, yeah you did, you were falling out of a building, if I hadn’t saved you would be splat.” You say, crossing your arms.


He shakes his head before putting his mask back on, “I-uh have to get back to the city.” He says, turning around and starts swinging in the air. Shooting webs out of his wrists, he moved like a spider. Like the symbol what was on his suit, it made sense.


“What the hell…that’s a new one.” You gape to yourself before you speed towards him. Stopping him at his tracks.


“How did you do that?” You ask the guy; you were so sure that this Central City maybe he was from Keystone? Maybe this was Keystone?


“I-uh…I’m Spider-Man.” He says, puffing his chest out a bit, sounding a bit awkward.

You were visiting him at his lab at CCPD when it had happened, woke up a few months later and your lives were forever changed. With the good, came the bad, arguments and disagreements with Barry were more often and it wasn’t something either of you liked. But you both worked on it, communicating better, and things have been going well. It has been 3 years and your friendship were still strong, but now it was also a partnership, The Flash and Swift.


“Barry, Y/N, I need you both to take these with you, run somewhere and wait for our signal.” Cisco says as we enter the cortex, handing us the tachyon devices.

Taking the identical devices from Cisco, Barry and you speed change into your suits and sped away, meeting at the Keystone City boarder. Coming to a stop, Barry gives you a nod and you both start to talk to everyone back at S.T.A.R Labs through the comms, waiting for the signal.


“Okay you guys, we’re here, you got our location?” Barry asks through his comms, awaiting a response from Cisco or even Caitlin, as you did too. You were excited to try the tachyon device out, it’s supposed to be like this supercharge battery that well, charges the speed force in us.

Back at S.T.A.R Labs, Cisco asks us, “You good? You guys don’t need to like stretch or somethin’?”


“No no no we’re good, Cisco.” You answer, chuckling at your friend.

“Let’s take this tachyon enhancer out for a test drive.” Cisco says trying to sound cool, Caitlin and Iris standing closely behind him, not wanting to miss anything.


“Alright.” You say as you turn to face Barry. His hands come up to cup your face, fingers lightly brushing your cheeks before he places a gentle kiss to your lips. Pulling away, he nods, gives you a reassuring smile and places the device on his chest, you mimic his actions, jumping a bit at the sudden reaction you feel your body have to it, you feel kind of jittery and well, nervous. You lick your lips and ball up your fists before squeezing your eyes shut as you mentally prepare for the outcome of this.


“Whoo! Yeah!” Barry exhales, feeling the device work.

You have the same reaction; it really does feel like your speed force cells are being supercharged. “Woah, I feel that!” You exhale.


“That is the tachyon device, powering up the speed force in your cells like a quick charge battery.” Caitlin says, sounding very chipper.


“How do you guys feel?” She asks.

“Uh, weird, but in a good way.” You answer, feeling a rush of energy.

“Different, really different.” Barry says with a sweet smile plastered on his face. His excitement was quite evident.


“Let’s see how long it takes for you to get back here, on my count…” Cisco says. That was the signal, well kind of, it was a count-down but same thing. You and Barry, got into position, waiting for that go.


“You ready Flash?” You smirk at the handsome speedster next to you.

“…3..2…”

“As ready as you are Swift.” He grins, shooting you a rather flirty smirk.

“..1..Go!” Cisco says as starts watching the timer on the clock, waiting for Barry and you to return to the S.T.A.R Labs.

Barry and you run, much much faster than before.


“Dang, this thing has them crusin’…” Cisco says, honestly impressed by you guys speed.


“How fast do they normally go?” Iris asks, interested about this whole situation and kind of worried about you and Barry.

“Not this fast.” Caitlin says nonchalantly.

“Not even close, are their vitals okay?” Cisco asks as his eyes widen at how fast the two of you are running around, the city.

Looking at the screen, Caitlin is relieved and kind of impressed, “Yeah, they’re perfect.”


“Cool, it’s like having a pit stop attached to your chest.” Iris says impressed.

“Guys, I can go faster!” You say as you ran throughout the city.

“Yeah, guys, me too!” Barry says.

A grin appears on Cisco’s face as he simply says, “Do it.”


Smiling to yourself you ran, faster that you’ve ever ran before. Hell, probably faster than Barry has too, but you sort of ran so fast that you managed to travel to another Earth. You didn’t know that at first, but you found out eventually.


How did you find that out, well eventually from the guy dressed in a red and blue suit who you saved from a falling building indirectly told you so? After speaking to him for a few minutes you knew for a fact that he wasn’t a meta from Central City.

You had spotted him the moment you came to a stop, scanning the area you, ran up the building, catching him swiftly, like your name sake and ran towards a field, although you didn’t mean too.


“I’m on fire!” the guy exclaims, through his mask as he tried to put the fire out.

“Yeah uh… sorry about that it happens sometimes, with the fiction of running at…” You say but the actions of the guy makes you stop for a moment, you look at him, his suit, head to toe and wonder, who is he and where did he get it, but he has something else to say, something extremely weird but not unbelievable.

“You sound like her.” He says, taking a step back and removing his mask. You examined his face, but sadness clouded his features. He looked at you, but you had your mask on, your identity was still hidden, and it seemed to disappoint him.


“By the way, I didn’t need you to save me.” He grimaced.

You were taken aback by that statement, confused. “Uh, yeah you did, you were falling out of a building, if I hadn’t saved you would be splat.” You say, crossing your arms.


He shakes his head before putting his mask back on, “I-uh have to get back to the city.” He says, turning around and starts swinging in the air. Shooting webs out of his wrists, he moved like a spider. Like the symbol what was on his suit, it made sense.


“What the hell…that’s a new one.” You gape to yourself before you speed towards him. Stopping him at his tracks.


“How did you do that?” You ask the guy; you were so sure that this Central City maybe he was from Keystone? Maybe this was Keystone?


“I-uh…I’m Spider-Man.” He says, puffing his chest out a bit, sounding a bit awkward.

summary: helloo. i wanted to know if u could please write a peter parker x reader blurb where y/n didn't know that peter is spiderman and...
question: helloo. i wanted to know if u could please write a peter parker x reader blurb where y/n didn't know that peter is spiderman and she gets really upset because he hid that from her and it gets worse when she finds out that mj (who she's not very fond of her) knows but she didn't know?thankssss
answer:
Are we supposed to not like MJ now? I sense a theme. Anyways… we’ll do this once.

“What is this??” You asked pulling a Spider-Man suit from Peter’s suitcase that had flipped off his bed and to the floor as you sat down.

“Nothing,” he quickly said grabbing it from your hand. You could tell he was lying, badly. “Just pjs. Pajamas.”

“You wear a Spider-Man suit… to bed?” You asked looking at him. He gulped visibly.

“Big fan, yeah. You?” He asked and you stared slightly open mouthed lost for words.

“He’s..Fine. You’re Spider-Man aren’t you? That’s you,” you said. Peter looked a bit like he wanted to pass out.

“Nope. I’m not,” he said shaking his head.

“Shut up. It’s obvious. How long?” You asked. The door opened and Ned and MJ walked in.

“She knows too?!” Ned asked.

“No,” Peter said.

“Yeah I know. How long have you two known?” You asked suspiciously.

“A few years,” Ned blurt out.

“Since last year,” MJ added. You looked at all of them a bit hurt.

“Cool. I’m just gonna go for a walk. My head wants to explode,” you said with an almost unhinged laugh. The three watched you leave.

“Peter, if you don’t follow her, you are an idiot,” MJ said sitting on his bed.

“What? Oh, right,” Peter said throwing his shoes on and running out. He caught you walking out the building. “Hey! Hey wait!”

You turned to look at him. No tears. Good sign. “What?” You asked before wiping the hair that flung in your eyes in the wind from your face. “Sorry.”

“No that’s fine. I’m sorry I didn’t tell you- You’re walking really fast,” he said. You slowed down. “I didn’t tell you because I didnt want you to worry.”

“I AM worried. Like really worried. You almost died. I saw it on tv,” you said. You had stopped walking on a street corner. A rude look from a woman with a stroller you kept moving.

“I mean, we both died in the snap,” he said. You gave him a look. “That’s not the point.”

“Why did you tell MJ before me? Is this why you are so close?” You asked. You looked up trying to not cry. It was stupid.

“I mean kinda. I didn’t tell her. Or Ned. Or Aunt May. They all found out like you did. Because I’m an idiot. Sorry,” he said walking around a guy sitting on the street. “Can we stop somewhere?”

“Okay,” you said pulling him into a pizzeria. The air conditioner felt nice. You sat at a table.

“I’m sorry. Now you know. I just didn’t want you to worry or get hurt. I’m an idiot okay? Complete idiot. Please don’t be mad at me,” he said with his big brown eyes and you wanted to be mad but couldn’t.

“No more secrets?”

“No more. Your grandma is planning a surprise party next weekend for your birthday,” he said.

“Why would you ruin that?” You said shocked. Peter closed his eyes and covered his face.

“You said no secrets. I really am an idiot,” he laughed nervously. “I don’t know. I just don’t-

“Shut up. You’re fine,” you said moving his hands and kissing his lips.

“You have 15 minutes...
body:
Friendly Neighborhood Spiderman Pt 4

Word Count: 2761

Peter Parker/ Spiderman x Reader

A/N: Sorry this one is so long, but I don’t care. :P

“You have 15 minutes left.”

I glanced up at the clock and back down at my test. I’d finished five minutes ago but I was going back over every single answer. There was one question that I wasn’t sure about. I specifically remembered Peter explaining how to do this problem but I couldn’t remember whether the explanation contained ‘do’ or ‘do not.’

“Fuck it,” I mumbled under my breath as I boxed in my answer and stood up.

I wasn’t the first one done but normally I was the last one finished so a lot of people turned to look at me. I kept my eyes on the clock as I marched up to my teacher’s desk. He looked at me over his glasses like a hawk watching a mouse.

“Ms. (Y/L/N),” he muttered as he took my test from my hand. “Are you sure you don’t want to check your answers again?”

I’ll check my answers up your butt.

I shook my head and marched out of the classroom. It was mid passing period when I got to my locker and I had to elbow my way through people that had no spacial awareness. I winced as my locker door bounced off my head with a clang and gave the guy next to me a dirty look. Luckily for him the hallway began to clear out before I could hurt him and make it look like an accident.

“Hey,” someone said from behind me. I glanced over my shoulder to see Peter nervously gripping the straps of his backpack. “How’d the test go?”

“There was only one that tripped me up!” I said excitedly. “I can’t thank you enough!”

I threw my arms around his neck and this time he hugged me back immediately. He lifted me off the ground as he hugged me tighter in a bone crushing hug. I laughed as he set me back down.

“Hey, guys.”

Peter and I jumped away from each other to see MJ and Ned standing next to each other. Both of them had the same stupid shit eating grin plastered across their faces. Before I could say anything Peter began to stammer out what he must have thought sounded like an explanation. I elbowed him in the side and he immediately shut his mouth.

“Hey MJ, Ned…” I started. “Uh…”

“How’d the math test go?” MJ asked, leaning against the lockers.

“I think I did really well,” I said turning to close my locker. “Peter was just congratulating me.”

“Looks like more than congratulating…” MJ muttered next to my ear.

“So are you guys excited about the…” Ned trailed off and dramatically looked up and down the hallway.

“the party?” he whispered. I laughed as MJ and Peter stared at him.

The bell rang before I could respond to Ned and MJ and I left Ned and Peter standing at my locker and I could feel her judgement bubbling inside her.

“So…”

“I don’t wanna talk about it,” I muttered, making her grin even wider.

—————-

MJ and I walked up the stairs to Betty’s house and stood at the front door.

“Just how loaded do we think Betty’s parents are?” I asked MJ, still looking up at the house.

“A three story home in one of the most expensive neighborhoods in Brooklyn?” MJ replied, also looking up at the house. “You wanna ask? If I ask it’ll be without- what was is you said- tact?”

I snorted as she opened the door and I followed her in. The house was bursting at the seams with students from Midtown; half of which were drunk and half of which were stoned. As soon as we crossed the threshold, I immediately regretted coming to this party.  

MJ’s hand was already around my wrist.  

“If I’m here, you’re here,” she muttered out of the corner of her mouth as she waved at someone across the room. “We’ll just stay until Peter and Ned get here and then we can leave.”

I yanked my arm from her and grudgingly sighed.

“I’ll go get us something to drink,” I said as MJ lovingly flipped me off before strutting into the kitchen.

I sighed and squeezed in between drunken teenagers until I was standing in front of a drink table that had been heavily looted. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw someone slide up next to me

“What’s up, (Y/L/N)?”

I turned to see Flash leaning against the drink table. He was looking at me with what I could only describe as dull bedroom eyes. Creepy, dull bedroom eyes.

“Uh. Hey, Flash, ” I said as I turned around to go find MJ.

“You don’t usually come out to parties,” Flash said, following me (unfortunately.) “It’s nice to see you out living life instead of cooped up studying with Penis Parker.”

“What’s that supposed to mean?” I asked over my shoulder. Flash was generally annoying but right now he was being exceptionally annoying.

I finally spotted MJ-eating gherkins from the jar- standing at Betty’s kitchen counter.

“Well, ya know,” he said, still following me. “One of the cutest girls in Academic Decathlon hanging out with one of the weirdest dudes…”

“Uh,” I was a little lost for words.

I passed MJ her drink and widened my eyes at her in a non verbal ‘yikes.’ She didn’t respond but held a gherkin out on the end of her fork and I rolled my eyes before accepting and letting her feed it to me.

“Anyway,’ Flash said leaning against the counter next to me. “I heard Penis was helping you study for the calc test, which is weird because he’s not even in our class.”

“Don’t call him that,” I said taking a sip of my drink and grimacing as it burnt my throat. “And does it matter who I study calc with?”

“It doesn’t, but I’m pretty sure I have a better grade in calc-”

“Yeah fuckin’ right, Flash,” MJ said crunching on a pickle.

Flash looked a little dejected but obviously MJ and I were going to have to be meaner to him if we wanted him to leave us alone.

“Anyway, (Y/N), you take the bus right?” he asked.

“I used to. I take the subway now,” I said taking another sip and grimacing. Why is everyone so concerned with my method of commute?

“Well,” Flash said sliding closer to me along the counter. I glanced at MJ who looked away with a nonverbal ‘oof.’ Flash’s hip bumped mine and he put his arm over my shoulders. “I happen to have a car and if you ever want a ride to school…”

I glanced at the floor before taking a large gulp of my drink- followed by a grimace. Flash wouldn’t shut up and I really wanted to stab him with the fork MJ was using but decided to just drink more. And grimace more.

I heard someone say my name as I took another sip of my drink. I looked up to see Peter standing in front of me, and I felt butterflies in my stomach. He was looking at Flash like he was going to break his arm, and it was… kind of a turn on?

“Peter!” I gasped. I threw Flash’s arm off and grabbed Peter around the neck. His arms were around my waist almost right away.

“Oh thank God. Please tell me Flash is gone,” I whispered into his ear.

“Hey what’s up Penis?” Flash said, answering my question. I felt Peter stiffen slightly. “I was telling (Y/N) that I could drive her to school sometime. You know…”

Flash continued to taIk and I pulled away to look at Peter. He looked irritated but otherwise fine. I rolled my eyes as he droned on behind us.

“You didn’t get lost,” Peter murmured quietly as he smirked down at me.  

“Yeah, well. I had MJ,” I said. I was definitely beginning to feel buzzed.

“Hey, Penis,” Flash said behind us. “What’s it like wiping Tony Stark’s ass everyday?”

I abruptly turned around.

“Oh my God, Flash. Are you still here?” I asked looking him up and down. “Isn’t there somewhere else you can be insecure about your dick size?”

Flash looked more surprised than offended by what I said, but nonetheless stalked out of the kitchen.

“Yikes, that was a little harsh, (Y/N),” Ned said. He was standing next to Peter, who was smiling ear to ear.

“Hi, Ned. Nice hat,” I said finishing off my drink. I let out a rasping breath, almost expecting fire to come out of my mouth. “And, yeah. Probably.”

“Wow, even Ned thinks you were harsh,” MJ said, offering me another gherkin. I accepted.

“I’m sure he’ll get over it,” Peter said, still grinning.

“I need another drink and you two don’t have one,” I said looking back and forth between Ned and Peter. “And I only have two hands, do-”

“I’ll go with you!” Ned blurted.

Peter glanced over at him and Ned nodded at him. I furrowed my eyebrows and looked between my three friends. MJ was looking at Ned the same way Peter was; the only difference being that Peter was rapidly turning pink.

Ned and I made our way to the drink table and I smiled at his excitement.

“Are you…?” I asked holding up a bottle of clear alcohol. He shook his head. “Do you think Peter…?”

“He didn’t say no before we left so…”

I smiled and made Peter a weak drink.

“So…” Ned started. “You and Peter…”

I froze and felt my cheeks begin to get warm.

“Did Peter put you up to this?” I asked as I handed him a soda. Ned didn’t have a good poker face but he didn’t say anything else. I smiled. “C’mon.”

“So do you… ya know…?” Ned asked as we walked back into the kitchen.

“You’re gonna have to be more specific,” I said as I turned around and quickly walked straight to Peter and handed him his drink. “Ned and I just had a very interesting conversation, Peter.”

Peter’s eyes widened into his drink and he quickly brought the cup to his mouth and took a gulp- one that he obviously regretted. He made a face similar to the one that I made every time I took a sip of my drink.

“I assume it was, I can’t really remember,” I said glancing at Ned out of the corner of my eye. He visibly relaxed.

“You can’t remember? How much have you had to drink? Or, uh, how long have you been here?” Peter asked as he set his drink down on the counter. I look another large sip.

“Peter,” I said through a grimace. “Do you know what the term ‘light-weight’ means?”

——————-

The subway was pretty empty, so Peter and I were able to sit this time. Ned sat across from us and MJ was standing. She had to change trains before any of our stops.

“I’ll see you Sunday,” she said. We were holding pinkies in my semi-drunken state. “And please get home safe you fuckin’ dork.”

I closed my eyes and smiled at her.

“I looove you, MJ,” I said as the train pulled to a stop.

“Ew.”

She stepped off the train.

“I LOVE YOU!” I yelled after her.

“I DON’T KNOW YOU!”

The doors closed and my butt vibrated as the train began to take off. I had to squint at my phone because I was maybe a little too drunk to read.

MJ: love you too.

Ned got off at the next stop and as soon as the train took off I laid my head on Peter’s shoulder.

“Do you know which stop you are?” he asked. I squinted up at the subway map.

“If I say no does that mean you’ll walk me home?” I asked. He chuckled.

“To the side walk?”

I felt my heart start to pick up the pace.

“Uh, actually. Do you want to maybe watch that crime documentary?” I asked nervously. Peter looked down at me and I shifted to look up at him. He had a smile tugging at the corner of his mouth and he arched an eyebrow at me. “Only if you want to though, I wouldn’t want-“

“I want to,” he said. I broke a smile and he smiled back down at me. “Also, the next stop is yours.”

He stood up and held his hand out to help me up. I graciously accepted. Normally I would have immediately let go of his hand but in my emboldened state I entwined my fingers in his as we walked towards the doors. He squeezed my hand as we stepped off the train.

The walk to my apartment was comfortably quiet. Every now and then, one of us would comment about our immediate surroundings but we didn’t speak any further than that.

My mind was racing. Well, as much as it could run with the amount of alcohol it was handling.

We’re just going to watch people murdering each other. Do not set any expectations for this, (Y/N).

But I couldn’t help but let my mind wander. I imagined his lips on mine; what they would feel like on mine, if they’d be soft. I glanced at him, trying to determine if he had chapped lips or not. He noticed.

“What?” he said using his other hand to wipe his upper lip. “Do I have a pimple or something?”

I shook my head and looked away. We walked further down the block and I almost had my arm ripped out of the socket when I walked past Peter. I turned to look back at him irritably. He had a very smug look on his face and he simply pointed at the building in front of us.

Which was my building.

“How drunk are you?” he asked as I opened the door and walked to the elevator. There was a maintenance sign taped to it, indicating it was not functional.

“Oof. Too drunk to take the fuckin’ stairs that is fo’ sho.”

Fo’ sho’? The fuck was that?

Suddenly, I wasn’t on my feet anymore: Peter had scooped me up in his arms and was already carrying me up the stairs.

“Peter! Stop, it’s- I live on the fifth floor,” I said wrapping my arms around his neck.

“Shut up, its fine,” he responded. His voice was surprisingly even, and as we started up the second flight of stairs he didn’t even break a sweat.

On the fifth floor, Peter set me down and I let us into my apartment. I gave Peter the remote and I retreated to my room so I could change. Staring in the mirror, I took a couple deep breaths.

No expectations.

Peter was playing a game on his phone when I walked out into the living room.

“You’re in my spot,” I teased as I sat next to him and curled my feet under me.

He chuckled and started the episode. The alcohol was making me feel brave, so I scooted closer to him and laid my head on his shoulder. He stiffened for the briefest moment before he shifted and around put his arm around my shoulder.

Peter began to run his fingers through my hair and I leaned against his hand, inviting him to continue. I took the hem of his shirt and began to roll the seam in my finger tips. It started to get harder to keep my eyes open and I felt myself drifting off.

“Peter,” I mumbled. He hummed at me. “I want to lay down.”

I began to sit up so I could go to my bedroom but Peter shifted around so I could lay against his chest along the couch and still watch the show. I smiled as I listened to his heart beat and began to match my breathing to his. I could tell I was about to fall asleep as Peter continued to play with my hair.

“Peter?”

“Hm?”

“Thanks,” I said as I let my eyes close.

“For?” he asked shifted a little. His cheek was now pressed into the top of my head.

The best I could respond with was a hum as I began to drift out of consciousness and into the world of sleep.

“Yikes, that was a little harsh, (Y/N),” Ned said. He was standing next to Peter, who was smiling ear to ear.

“Hi, Ned. Nice hat,” I said finishing off my drink. I let out a rasping breath, almost expecting fire to come out of my mouth. “And, yeah. Probably.”

“Wow, even Ned thinks you were harsh,” MJ said, offering me another gherkin. I accepted.

“I’m sure he’ll get over it,” Peter said, still grinning.

“I need another drink and you two don’t have one,” I said looking back and forth between Ned and Peter. “And I only have two hands, do-”

“I’ll go with you!” Ned blurted.

Peter glanced over at him and Ned nodded at him. I furrowed my eyebrows and looked between my three friends. MJ was looking at Ned the same way Peter was; the only difference being that Peter was rapidly turning pink.

Ned and I made our way to the drink table and I smiled at his excitement.

“Are you…?” I asked holding up a bottle of clear alcohol. He shook his head. “Do you think Peter…?”

“He didn’t say no before we left so…”

I smiled and made Peter a weak drink.

“So…” Ned started. “You and Peter…”

I froze and felt my cheeks begin to get warm.

“Did Peter put you up to this?” I asked as I handed him a soda. Ned didn’t have a good poker face but he didn’t say anything else. I smiled. “C’mon.”

“So do you… ya know…?” Ned asked as we walked back into the kitchen.

“You’re gonna have to be more specific,” I said as I turned around and quickly walked straight to Peter and handed him his drink. “Ned and I just had a very interesting conversation, Peter.”

Peter’s eyes widened into his drink and he quickly brought the cup to his mouth and took a gulp- one that he obviously regretted. He made a face similar to the one that I made every time I took a sip of my drink.

“I assume it was, I can’t really remember,” I said glancing at Ned out of the corner of my eye. He visibly relaxed.

“You can’t remember? How much have you had to drink? Or, uh, how long have you been here?” Peter asked as he set his drink down on the counter. I look another large sip.

“Peter,” I said through a grimace. “Do you know what the term ‘light-weight’ means?”

MJ and Peter chuckled as I took another sip that burned less than the first drink did. I had a feeling that tonight was going to be a good night.

——————-

The subway was pretty empty, so Peter and I were able to sit this time. Ned sat across from us and MJ was standing. She had to change trains before any of our stops.

“I’ll see you Sunday,” she said. We were holding pinkies in my semi-drunken state. “And please get home safe you fuckin’ dork.”

I closed my eyes and smiled at her.

“I looove you, MJ,” I said as the train pulled to a stop.

“Ew.”

She stepped off the train.

“I LOVE YOU!” I yelled after her.

“I DON’T KNOW YOU!”

The doors closed and my butt vibrated as the train began to take off. I had to squint at my phone because I was maybe a little too drunk to read.

MJ: love you too.

Ned got off at the next stop and as soon as the train took off I laid my head on Peter’s shoulder.

“Do you know which stop you are?” he asked. I squinted up at the subway map.

“If I say no does that mean you’ll walk me home?” I asked. He chuckled.

“To the side walk?”

I felt my heart start to pick up the pace.

“Uh, actually. Do you want to maybe watch that crime documentary?” I asked nervously. Peter looked down at me and I shifted to look up at him. He had a smile tugging at the corner of his mouth and he arched an eyebrow at me. “Only if you want to though, I wouldn’t want-“

“I want to,” he said. I broke a smile and he smiled back down at me. “Also, the next stop is yours.”

He stood up and held his hand out to help me up. I graciously accepted. Normally I would have immediately let go of his hand but in my emboldened state I entwined my fingers in his as we walked towards the doors. He squeezed my hand as we stepped off the train.

The walk to my apartment was comfortably quiet. Every now and then, one of us would comment about our immediate surroundings but we didn’t speak any further than that.

My mind was racing. Well, as much as it could run with the amount of alcohol it was handling.

We’re just going to watch people murdering each other. Do not set any expectations for this, (Y/N).

But I couldn’t help but let my mind wander. I imagined his lips on mine; what they would feel like on mine, if they’d be soft. I glanced at him, trying to determine if he had chapped lips or not. He noticed.

“What?” he said using his other hand to wipe his upper lip. “Do I have a pimple or something?”

I shook my head and looked away. We walked further down the block and I almost had my arm ripped out of the socket when I walked past Peter. I turned to look back at him irritably. He had a very smug look on his face and he simply pointed at the building in front of us.

Which was my building.

“How drunk are you?” he asked as I opened the door and walked to the elevator. There was a maintenance sign taped to it, indicating it was not functional.

“Oof. Too drunk to take the fuckin’ stairs that is fo’ sho.”

Fo’ sho’? The fuck was that?

Suddenly, I wasn’t on my feet anymore: Peter had scooped me up in his arms and was already carrying me up the stairs.

“Peter! Stop, it’s- I live on the fifth floor,” I said wrapping my arms around his neck.

“Shut up, its fine,” he responded. His voice was surprisingly even, and as we started up the second flight of stairs he didn’t even break a sweat.

On the fifth floor, Peter set me down and I let us into my apartment. I gave Peter the remote and I retreated to my room so I could change. Staring in the mirror, I took a couple deep breaths.

No expectations.

Peter was playing a game on his phone when I walked out into the living room.

“You’re in my spot,” I teased as I sat next to him and curled my feet under me.

He chuckled and started the episode. The alcohol was making me feel brave, so I scooted closer to him and laid my head on his shoulder. He stiffened for the briefest moment before he shifted and around put his arm around my shoulder.

Peter began to run his fingers through my hair and I leaned against his hand, inviting him to continue. I took the hem of his shirt and began to roll the seam in my finger tips. It started to get harder to keep my eyes open and I felt myself drifting off.

“Peter,” I mumbled. He hummed at me. “I want to lay down.”

I began to sit up so I could go to my bedroom but Peter shifted around so I could lay against his chest along the couch and still watch the show. I smiled as I listened to his heart beat and began to match my breathing to his. I could tell I was about to fall asleep as Peter continued to play with my hair.

“Peter?”

“Hm?”

“Thanks,” I said as I let my eyes close.

“For?” he asked shifted a little. His cheek was now pressed into the top of my head.

The best I could respond with was a hum as I began to drift out of consciousness and into the world of sleep.

Peter Parker/ Spiderman x Reader

“You have 15 minutes left.”

I glanced up at the clock and back down at my test. I’d finished five minutes ago but I was going back over every single answer. There was one question that I wasn’t sure about. I specifically remembered Peter explaining how to do this problem but I couldn’t remember whether the explanation contained ‘do’ or ‘do not.’

“Fuck it,” I mumbled under my breath as I boxed in my answer and stood up.

I wasn’t the first one done but normally I was the last one finished so a lot of people turned to look at me. I kept my eyes on the clock as I marched up to my teacher’s desk. He looked at me over his glasses like a hawk watching a mouse.

“Ms. (Y/L/N),” he muttered as he took my test from my hand. “Are you sure you don’t want to check your answers again?”

I’ll check my answers up your butt.

I shook my head and marched out of the classroom. It was mid passing period when I got to my locker and I had to elbow my way through people that had no spacial awareness. I winced as my locker door bounced off my head with a clang and gave the guy next to me a dirty look. Luckily for him the hallway began to clear out before I could hurt him and make it look like an accident.

“Hey,” someone said from behind me. I glanced over my shoulder to see Peter nervously gripping the straps of his backpack. “How’d the test go?”

“There was only one that tripped me up!” I said excitedly. “I can’t thank you enough!”

I threw my arms around his neck and this time he hugged me back immediately. He lifted me off the ground as he hugged me tighter in a bone crushing hug. I laughed as he set me back down.

“Hey, guys.”

Peter and I jumped away from each other to see MJ and Ned standing next to each other. Both of them had the same stupid shit eating grin plastered across their faces. Before I could say anything Peter began to stammer out what he must have thought sounded like an explanation. I elbowed him in the side and he immediately shut his mouth.

“Hey MJ, Ned…” I started. “Uh…”

“How’d the math test go?” MJ asked, leaning against the lockers.

“I think I did really well,” I said turning to close my locker. “Peter was just congratulating me.”

“Looks like more than congratulating…” MJ muttered next to my ear.

“So are you guys excited about the…” Ned trailed off and dramatically looked up and down the hallway.

“the party?” he whispered. I laughed as MJ and Peter stared at him.

The bell rang before I could respond to Ned and MJ and I left Ned and Peter standing at my locker and I could feel her judgement bubbling inside her.

“So…”

“I don’t wanna talk about it,” I muttered, making her grin even wider.

“A three story home in one of the most expensive neighborhoods in Brooklyn?” MJ replied, also looking up at the house. “You wanna ask? If I ask it’ll be without- what was is you said- tact?”

MJ’s hand was already around my wrist.  

“If I’m here, you’re here,” she muttered out of the corner of her mouth as she waved at someone across the room. “We’ll just stay until Peter and Ned get here and then we can leave.”

I yanked my arm from her and grudgingly sighed.

“What’s up, (Y/L/N)?”

“It doesn’t, but I’m pretty sure I have a better grade in calc-”

“Yeah fuckin’ right, Flash,” MJ said crunching on a pickle.

Flash looked a little dejected but obviously MJ and I were going to have to be meaner to him if we wanted him to leave us alone.

“Anyway, (Y/N), you take the bus right?” he asked.

“I used to. I take the subway now,” I said taking another sip and grimacing. Why is everyone so concerned with my method of commute?

Flash continued to taIk and I pulled away to look at Peter. He looked irritated but otherwise fine. I rolled my eyes as he droned on behind us.

“You didn’t get lost,” Peter murmured quietly as he smirked down at me.  

“Yeah, well. I had MJ,” I said. I was definitely beginning to feel buzzed.

“Hey, Penis,” Flash said behind us. “What’s it like wiping Tony Stark’s ass everyday?”

I abruptly turned around.

“Oh my God, Flash. Are you still here?” I asked looking him up and down. “Isn’t there somewhere else you can be insecure about your dick size?”

Flash looked more surprised than offended by what I said, but nonetheless stalked out of the kitchen.

Ned and I made our way to the drink table and I smiled at his excitement.

I froze and felt my cheeks begin to get warm.

“You’re gonna have to be more specific,” I said as I turned around and quickly walked straight to Peter and handed him his drink. “Ned and I just had a very interesting conversation, Peter.”

Peter’s eyes widened into his drink and he quickly brought the cup to his mouth and took a gulp- one that he obviously regretted. He made a face similar to the one that I made every time I took a sip of my drink.

“I assume it was, I can’t really remember,” I said glancing at Ned out of the corner of my eye. He visibly relaxed.

“You can’t remember? How much have you had to drink? Or, uh, how long have you been here?” Peter asked as he set his drink down on the counter. I look another large sip.

“Peter,” I said through a grimace. “Do you know what the term ‘light-weight’ means?”

MJ and Peter chuckled as I took another sip that burned less than the first drink did. I had a feeling that tonight was going to be a good night.

——————-

“I’ll see you Sunday,” she said. We were holding pinkies in my semi-drunken state. “And please get home safe you fuckin’ dork.”

I closed my eyes and smiled at her.

“I looove you, MJ,” I said as the train pulled to a stop.

“Ew.”

She stepped off the train.

“I LOVE YOU!” I yelled after her.

“I DON’T KNOW YOU!”

The doors closed and my butt vibrated as the train began to take off. I had to squint at my phone because I was maybe a little too drunk to read.

MJ: love you too.

body:
Secret World

Chapter 3

Peter stood with his mouth wide open as Bucky swore under his breath, Sam let out a chuckle and clapped the other man on his shoulder. Bucky took a deep breath before standing straight back up, his eyes shooting daggers at the kid who slowly brought his hand over his mouth to cover the amused look that was slowly starting to form on his face.

“Looks like she got the drop on ya Buck.” Sam stated in a amused tone, Bucky’s eyes whipped over and he glared at his companion, his lip twitched with annoyance.

“Screw you, Bird Boy.” Bucky grimaced with a roll of his eyes as he recomposed himself. “Any idea who she is?”

“No, she just seemed really confused.” Peter replied as he looked Bucky up and down. “Did that really hurt?”

“Nah, it was quite enjoyable, or course it hurt, why would you even ask?” Bucky snapped, looking down the street that the mystery woman had went.

“Well, I mean, it’s just you’re, like, a super solider and everything, I just assumed..” Peter trailed off with a shrug of his shoulders.

“Super solider or not, a kick to the nuts is still a kick to the nuts and it does hurt.” Bucky replied sharply, slowly he looked over to Sam who had a smirk on his face. “Kid, I think she’ll be okay.”

    “I have to agree to him, she seemed pretty capable of handling this old man.” Sam stayed, slapping Bucky on the arm which earned him a scowl. “You better get going, otherwise you’ll be late to school.”

    “But, she.” Peter started to say as he pointed toward the direction she had run off in.

“Pete, she’ll be fine. We’ll keep an eye out, if she turns up again we’ll find her.” Sam told him, point in the opposite direction. “School. Now.”

Peter rolled his eyes as he turned and started back down the way he had originally been going, his shoulders slumped. He couldn’t wait to graduate, that way he focus more of his time doing things to help people.

——-

I kept running, dodging around people, trying to get away. I didn’t bother to look behind me, this was crazy, there was no way I was in the future by four years. The kid had to have been messing with me, after all finding a woman half dead in the middle of the street would of been an easy target.

Then you factor in Ice man and Warm man, which seemed to have come out of no where. They all knew each other, maybe some kind of street gang, blue eyes would certainly have been the muscle. The kid, maybe a runner? Maybe he was the one that kept his feelers out, would of made sense for him to call his bosses. Mocha man, definitely the smarter of the three, he was the brains.

Who knew if there was more, they could be on every street corner for all I knew. I slowed down, putting as many streets and turns between me and them as possible. I looked over my shoulder, to my surprise I didn’t see anyone. Well, I saw lots of people but not them.

As I started to walk past one of the many street corner vendors I saw a newspaper paper stand and the headline on the New York Times cause me to pause. Post Snap, Five Years After Thanos. Post snap? Isn’t that what the kid said? And what was Thanos?

"How much for the paper?” I questioned the older woman sitting behind the table.

“Two dollars.” She replied, not bothering to look up, I pulled my wallet out of my back pocket and handed my debt card over. I opened the paper as I waited for her to swipe my card.

The year 2018 an alien being dusted half the population? Half of everything living gone within seconds, and then a couple months ago people who called themselves the Avengers..

“Miss, your card is declining, do you have another form of payment?” She asked, interrupting me. I looked up at her a blinked hard a couple of times, how? I literally just got paid yesterday.

“Uh..” I opened my wallet and just like any other day of my life it was void of any actual cash. “No, I’m sorry.”

    She handed the card back to me as I started to walk away leaving the paper on the counter top. 2018 was last year, those events didn’t happen, the date on the paper though said it was 2023. I don’t understand, how could possibly be four years in the future and the events of last year change?

     I stopped at the street corner and looked around, my brain refusing to process the very real possibility that some how I was in alternate reality. An alternate world in which the world had been attacked by some alien creature, or creatures just as my vision had shown before I ran into the theater bathroom. How it happened, I have no idea, I didn’t pay much attention to the possibility of timelines and realities that ran side by side. But the very little knowledge I did have would make more since that the years should run side by side.

     Unless somehow in this world if there was a me, which could be a possibility, somehow got swapped with the me from my world. Or, there was a secret black hole in the bathroom that I just happened to stumble upon. All I knew is none of this made any sense, it was time to do some research though. Time to make some sense of the events that were surrounding me.

———

     Peter watched the clock on the wall in his last period. He hadn’t been able to get the woman’s face out of his head, the look of shock and fear. Her genuine confusion about the snap, those who came back from the snap were always confused but she seemed more so then most.

    She had said Spiderling, Tony had called him that in his bed room when they first met, right before asking him to go Germany to help fight against Captain America and his team. Nobody knew that, and until she said it he had all forgotten about it as well. Maybe she knew Tony somehow, if she was snapped then she wouldn’t know that Tony was….

    Peter wiped his cheek, looking down from the clock and took a deep breath. He needed to find her again, he knew that Sam and Bucky didn’t seemed concerned by her but something in his gut told him there was something different about this woman.

Who knew if there was more, they could be on every street corner for all I knew. I slowed down, putting as many streets and turns between me and them as possible. I looked over my shoulder, to my surprise I didn’t see anyone. Well, I saw lots of people but not them.

As I started to walk past one of the many street corner vendors I saw a newspaper paper stand and the headline on the New York Times cause me to pause. Post Snap, Five Years After Thanos. Post snap? Isn’t that what the kid said? And what was Thanos?

"How much for the paper?” I questioned the older woman sitting behind the table.

“Two dollars.” She replied, not bothering to look up, I pulled my wallet out of my back pocket and handed my debt card over. I opened the paper as I waited for her to swipe my card.

The year 2018 an alien being dusted half the population? Half of everything living gone within seconds, and then a couple months ago people who called themselves the Avengers..

“Miss, your card is declining, do you have another form of payment?” She asked, interrupting me. I looked up at her a blinked hard a couple of times, how? I literally just got paid yesterday.

“Uh..” I opened my wallet and just like any other day of my life it was void of any actual cash. “No, I’m sorry.”

    She handed the card back to me as I started to walk away leaving the paper on the counter top. 2018 was last year, those events didn’t happen, the date on the paper though said it was 2023. I don’t understand, how could possibly be four years in the future and the events of last year change?

     I stopped at the street corner and looked around, my brain refusing to process the very real possibility that some how I was in alternate reality. An alternate world in which the world had been attacked by some alien creature, or creatures just as my vision had shown before I ran into the theater bathroom. How it happened, I have no idea, I didn’t pay much attention to the possibility of timelines and realities that ran side by side. But the very little knowledge I did have would make more since that the years should run side by side.

     Unless somehow in this world if there was a me, which could be a possibility, somehow got swapped with the me from my world. Or, there was a secret black hole in the bathroom that I just happened to stumble upon. All I knew is none of this made any sense, it was time to do some research though. Time to make some sense of the events that were surrounding me.

———

     Peter watched the clock on the wall in his last period. He hadn’t been able to get the woman’s face out of his head, the look of shock and fear. Her genuine confusion about the snap, those who came back from the snap were always confused but she seemed more so then most.

    She had said Spiderling, Tony had called him that in his bed room when they first met, right before asking him to go Germany to help fight against Captain America and his team. Nobody knew that, and until she said it he had all forgotten about it as well. Maybe she knew Tony somehow, if she was snapped then she wouldn’t know that Tony was….

    Peter wiped his cheek, looking down from the clock and took a deep breath. He needed to find her again, he knew that Sam and Bucky didn’t seemed concerned by her but something in his gut told him there was something different about this woman.

    “I have to agree to him, she seemed pretty capable of handling this old man.” Sam stayed, slapping Bucky on the arm which earned him a scowl. “You better get going, otherwise you’ll be late to school.”

    She handed the card back to me as I started to walk away leaving the paper on the counter top. 2018 was last year, those events didn’t happen, the date on the paper though said it was 2023. I don’t understand, how could possibly be four years in the future and the events of last year change?

     I stopped at the street corner and looked around, my brain refusing to process the very real possibility that some how I was in alternate reality. An alternate world in which the world had been attacked by some alien creature, or creatures just as my vision had shown before I ran into the theater bathroom. How it happened, I have no idea, I didn’t pay much attention to the possibility of timelines and realities that ran side by side. But the very little knowledge I did have would make more since that the years should run side by side.

     Unless somehow in this world if there was a me, which could be a possibility, somehow got swapped with the me from my world. Or, there was a secret black hole in the bathroom that I just happened to stumble upon. All I knew is none of this made any sense, it was time to do some research though. Time to make some sense of the events that were surrounding me.

    She had said Spiderling, Tony had called him that in his bed room when they first met, right before asking him to go Germany to help fight against Captain America and his team. Nobody knew that, and until she said it he had all forgotten about it as well. Maybe she knew Tony somehow, if she was snapped then she wouldn’t know that Tony was….

    Peter wiped his cheek, looking down from the clock and took a deep breath. He needed to find her again, he knew that Sam and Bucky didn’t seemed concerned by her but something in his gut told him there was something different about this woman.

summary: When You Sleep - Peter Parker Oneshot
title: When You Sleep - Peter Parker Oneshot
body:
Summary: You wake up. It’s a bad dream. You know you fought with all you got. Yet you feel weak and tired. You had him. Yet you lost him. You want a new dream, but you’re faced with the real reality.

Warnings: SAD AF! some fluffy flashbacks, mentions of death, angst

Word Count: 1,062

Pairing: Peter Parker x fem!Reader

A/n: SONG BASED!! You know how it is! Of Monsters and Men - Little Talks

~ I know that’s not where the song ends but it fits so…

~Masterlist~ 

What do you see? See when you fall asleep. Do you dream? Is it the nightmares that you imagine? Is it someone…someone you love perhaps, someone you lost? A friend, a best friend, or is it a lover?

Days upon days you drudged around the Avengers compound with a blanket wrapped tightly around your shoulders. All the energy you could possibly have was drained right out of you. You didn’t want to do anything anymore. You simply allowed yourself to let the tiredness take over your whole body. Everyone was worried about you, but then again they understood the circumstances. They’ve all lost someone they’ve deeply cared about, so watching you break down and isolate yourself was something they could relate to. Losing a loved one was never easy.

“You should eat something.”

“We should go out and do something.”

“You can’t stay in bed forever kiddo.”

“I miss him too ya know.”

Everyone’s words echoing in your head. It was as though it was constantly on replay. You knew how hard they were trying to made you feel anything else other than pain.

As much as you didn’t want to admit it. You could feel yourself losing. Losing yourself to the tragedy that occurred. That’s all your mind wandered off to. That night…the night you lost him. Peter. It was driving you to insanity, and you couldn’t stop thinking about him. Thinking about the way you lost him…the way you couldn’t save him. 

There’s an old voice in my head that’s holding me back
Well, tell her that I miss our little talks
Soon it will be over and buried with our past
We used to play outside when we were young, and full of life and full of love

The sleepless nights began around a couple months after the snap. After Thanos snapped away 50 percent of all living creatures. Taking your boyfriend in the process. You couldn’t fall under. Too scared of what you might see. If you slept you dreamt…and if you dreamt, you thought of him. You saw him. 

Some days, I don’t know if I am wrong or right
Your mind is playing tricks on you, my dear
Cause though the truth may vary, this ship will carry our
Bodies safe to shore

The nightmares didn’t help your cause. They differentiated from the dreams you had of Peter. When you had dreams, you were happy. Like that small part of him, that you held onto was still there. He was there. There with you. He wasn’t gone, he didn’t stop existing. He wasn’t wiped off the face of the earth. He was just there and he was there with you. He didn’t leave you. However, when the nightmares kicked into place. You woke up in cold sweats, your breathing was uneven. The fear that was in his voice when he felt the effect of the snap echoing in your head. Reminding you that you couldn’t prevent him from disintegrating. Your own voice crying out for him. You couldn’t move in this nightmare, you couldn’t reach out for him. You could only watch. Then he’d disappear and you’d wake up. Although you knew the nightmares were bad, you couldn’t help but think your dreams overpowered them.

Hey! Don’t listen to a word I say
Hey! The screams all sound the same
Hey! Though the truth may vary, this ship will carry our
Bodies safe to shore

You woke up in a gasp. Your hair sticking to your face. Your chest was heaving up and down. You placed a hand on your chest trying to control your breathing. It wasn’t working. You whimpered as it got too hard. The body next to you shifting. Peter opened his eyes quickly and sat up full alert this time.

“Y/n?” Peter realized too quickly just how bad this was. He sat up on his knees pushing the blanket off him. “Hey, hey. You’re okay, you’re okay. It was just a dream, just a dream okay.” Peter cooed at you trying to soothe you down.

“I-it felt real.” You mumbled. Your eyes were still watery from the sudden jolt you did when you woke up. 

“It was just a dream. Whatever it was it can’t harm you anymore.” Peter wrapped his arm around you bring you closer to his chest. He pecked your head as he rubbed soothing circles on your back. “D-Do you want to talk about it?” He looked down at you.

You shook your head no.

“Okay, let’s talk about something else then.”

“L-Like what?” You muttered.

“Like…like that new upgrade we need to get for your suit.” Peter shrugged.

“It does not need a new-” You stopped yourself short. “Okay, maybe it needs a few tweaks.” You laughed quietly.

“Come on.” Peter got off the bed and knelt down at the edge looking up at you with the most boyish smile you thought he could possibly muster.

“What?” You chuckled.

“Come on, Y/n. Come on.” He kept repeating.

“Where are we going?”

“Come on.” He smiled up at you. “Come on.”

Hey!
Hey!
Hey!

You sat up quickly gasping at the rush the dream gave you. You placed a hand on your chest. You gaze suddenly averting to your left side. Your other hand reaching out to feel the trace of the cold sheets. Then you looked at the edge of the bed. 

Peter wasn’t there. 

You sighed heavily as you realized that you were only imagining all of it. You closed your eyes wanting a chance. Any chance of seeing him again. 

One more glimpse of him.

One more.

You laid back down and made yourself comfortable. You tugged the blanket up to your neck and turned on your side. The side of that faced his. You closed your eyes and let sleep take over. You were lulled into another dream. A dream about Peter.

You’re gone, gone, gone away; I watched you disappear
All that’s left is a ghost of you
Now we’re torn, torn, torn apart; there’s nothing we can do
Just let me go, we’ll meet again soon

Now wait, wait, wait for me; please hang around
I’ll see you when I fall asleep…

Reminding you that you couldn’t prevent him from disintegrating. Your own voice crying out for him. You couldn’t move in this nightmare, you couldn’t reach out for him. You could only watch. Then he’d disappear and you’d wake up. Although you knew the nightmares were bad, you couldn’t help but think your dreams overpowered them.

Hey! Don’t listen to a word I say
Hey! The screams all sound the same
Hey! Though the truth may vary, this ship will carry our
Bodies safe to shore

You woke up in a gasp. Your hair sticking to your face. Your chest was heaving up and down. You placed a hand on your chest trying to control your breathing. It wasn’t working. You whimpered as it got too hard. The body next to you shifting. Peter opened his eyes quickly and sat up full alert this time.

“Y/n?” Peter realized too quickly just how bad this was. He sat up on his knees pushing the blanket off him. “Hey, hey. You’re okay, you’re okay. It was just a dream, just a dream okay.” Peter cooed at you trying to soothe you down.

“I-it felt real.” You mumbled. Your eyes were still watery from the sudden jolt you did when you woke up. 

“It was just a dream. Whatever it was it can’t harm you anymore.” Peter wrapped his arm around you bring you closer to his chest. He pecked your head as he rubbed soothing circles on your back. “D-Do you want to talk about it?” He looked down at you.

You shook your head no.

“Okay, let’s talk about something else then.”

“L-Like what?” You muttered.

“Like…like that new upgrade we need to get for your suit.” Peter shrugged.

“It does not need a new-” You stopped yourself short. “Okay, maybe it needs a few tweaks.” You laughed quietly.

“Come on.” Peter got off the bed and knelt down at the edge looking up at you with the most boyish smile you thought he could possibly muster.

“What?” You chuckled.

“Come on, Y/n. Come on.” He kept repeating.

“Where are we going?”

“Come on.” He smiled up at you. “Come on.”

Hey!
Hey!
Hey!

You sat up quickly gasping at the rush the dream gave you. You placed a hand on your chest. You gaze suddenly averting to your left side. Your other hand reaching out to feel the trace of the cold sheets. Then you looked at the edge of the bed. 

Peter wasn’t there. 

You sighed heavily as you realized that you were only imagining all of it. You closed your eyes wanting a chance. Any chance of seeing him again. 

One more glimpse of him.

One more.

You laid back down and made yourself comfortable. You tugged the blanket up to your neck and turned on your side. The side of that faced his. You closed your eyes and let sleep take over. You were lulled into another dream. A dream about Peter.

You’re gone, gone, gone away; I watched you disappear
All that’s left is a ghost of you
Now we’re torn, torn, torn apart; there’s nothing we can do
Just let me go, we’ll meet again soon

Now wait, wait, wait for me; please hang around
I’ll see you when I fall asleep…

"Looked at sky through smoke heavy with human fat and God was not there. The cold, suffocating dark goes on forever and we are alone. Live our lives, lacking anything better to do. Devise reason later. Born from oblivion; bear children, hell-bound as ourselves, go into oblivion. There is nothing else. Existence is random. Has no pattern save what we imagine after staring at it for too long. No meaning save what we choose to impose. This rudderless world is not shaped by vague metaphysical forces. It is not God who kills the children. Not fate that butchers them or destiny that feeds them to the dogs. It’s us. Only us. Streets stank of fire. The void breathed hard on my heart, turning its illusions to ice, shattering them. Was reborn then, free to scrawl own design on this morally blank world."
- - - Rorschach; Watchmen by Alan Moore
